intro: Desmos longiflorus, commonly known as the long-flowered desmos, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces delicate, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained conditions to flourish.
